title: DMK writes to TN Assembly secretary seeking no-confidence motion against Speaker
text:
Tamil Nadu Assembly Speaker P. Dhanapal. February 21, 2017 14:34  57 IST more-in The move comes a day after party working president M.K. Stalin filed a PIL plea challenging the vote on Motion of Confidence moved by Chief Minster Edappadi K. Palaniswami in the Assembly. 
The DMK on Tuesday wrote to the Tamil Nadu Assembly Secretary seeking a no-confidence motion against Speaker P. Dhanapal. 
The move comes a day after DMK working president M.K. Stalin filed a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) petition challenging the vote on Motion of Confidence moved by Chief Minster Edappadi K. Palaniswami in the Assembly on Saturday last. 
Mr. Stalinâ€™s counsel Shanmugasundaram on Tuesday alleged in the Madras High Court that the Speaker and Assembly Secretary are attempting to tamper with the records of the House proceedings of February 18. 
Senior counsel urged the First Bench of Acting Chief Justice Huluvadi G. Ramesh and Justice R. Mahadevan to urgently hear Mr. Stalin's petition, which prayed the court to declare the decision of the Speaker in accepting the vote of confidence as illegal, null and void. 
The PIL would be heard on Wednesday. 
(With inputs from PTI )
